data.title: Human Resources Associate
data.description:
Job Description

We are a fast growing US based Cloud solutions company looking to hire an experienced and highly skilled recruiter/HR Generalist to join the team. The candidate will have prior experience in recruitment and general human resources functions, with knowledge of screening, interviewing, and hiring practices. If you have a passion for finding untapped talent, driving company growth, and helping individuals find promising careers, we want to hear from you. Our ideal candidate will also have experience with HR, including onboarding, exit interviews, the administration of benefits and compensation, team restructuring, and conflict resolution. As the “face” of our company culture, he/she will have excellent communication and interpersonal skill, and enthusiasm for nurturing employee performance and a pleasant work environment.




Objectives of this Role

Work closely with managers to gain a comprehensive understanding of the company’s hiring needs for each position, and meet competitive hiring goals and expectations
Manage the full recruiting lifecycle across a variety of open roles helping management find, hire, and retain quality talent
Stay active with current with job boards, social networks, and platforms to find talent, and plan, create, and release job descriptions and announcements
Maintain, develop, and implement employee processes and procedures, using HR systems for proper documentation
Responsible for data/file management processes related to new hire and termination process across all related databases for all personnel
Contribute to the design, configuration, and communication activities related to ongoing and annual benefit enrollment process, program, and performance
Continuously seek to identify, improve, and automate current processes to improve the management and accessibility of key analytical data




Daily and Weekly Responsibilities

Work and form relationships with internal management teams to know the ins and outs of their departments and better understand their hiring needs and job specifications
Develop and release job postings on a platforms, such as social media and job boards
Utilize knowledge of multiple recruiting sources and execute innovative recruiting strategies to find quality candidates and prospect for new business
Screen resumes and prospects, qualify, interview, and manage candidates throughout interview process from prepping before interviews to assisting with final offer negotiation
Maintain a database of candidate records, including active and passive prospects, hired and fired employees, and other candidate relationships
Follow up on interview process status and update records in internal database
Support staff with HR-related issues, including, compensation, benefits, rewards and recognition, vacation, misconduct, and any problem resolution
Maintain/update HR records and employee files in accordance with compliance laws, and policies provide organizational change information for charts and presentations




Skills and Qualifications

2+ years’ experience in recruitment or human resources
Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and decision-making skills
Advanced knowledge of MS Office, database management, and internet search
Familiarity with job boards, and HR software, databases, and management systems
Proven experience conducting various types of interviews (i.e., phone, video, etc.)




Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in human resource management (or related field)
Experience developing recruiting strategy
Prior business development or sales experience

Company Description

Tesco Bengaluru

We are a multi-disciplinary team creating a sustainable competitive advantage for Tesco by standardising processes, delivering cost savings, enabling agility, providing cutting-edge technological solutions and empowering our colleagues to do ever more for our customers. With cross-functional expertise in Global Business Services and Retail Technology & Engineering, a wide network of teams and strong governance we reduce complexity thereby offering high quality services for our customers. Tesco Bengaluru, established in 2004 to enable standardisation and build centralised capabilities and competencies, makes the experience better for our millions of customers worldwide and simpler for over 4,40,000 colleagues.

At Tesco Business Services, we have a mission to simplify, scale & partner to serve our customers, colleagues and suppliers through a best in class intelligent Business Services model . We do this by building a world class business services model by executing service model framework right at the heart of everything we do for our worldwide customers. The key objective is to implement and execute service model across all our functions and markets consistently. The ethos of business services is to free-up our colleagues from a regular manual operational work. We use cognitive technology to augment our key decision making. We also built a Continuous Improvement (CI) culture across functions to drive bottom-up business efficiencies by optimising processes. Business services colleagues need to act as a business partner with our group stakeholders to build a collaborative partnership driving continuous improvement across markets and functions to lead the best customer experience by serving our shoppers a little better every day.

At Tesco, inclusion means that Everyone?s Welcome. Everyone is treated fairly and with respect; by valuing individuality and uniqueness we create a sense of belonging.

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the heart of Tesco. It is embedded in our values: we treat people how they want to be treated. We always want our colleagues to feel they can be themselves at work and we are committed to helping them be at their best.

Across the Tesco group we are building an inclusive workplace, a place to actively celebrate the cultures, personalities and preferences of our colleagues ? who in turn help to build the success of our business and reflect the diversity of the communities we serve.

Job Description

Following our Business Code of Conduct and always acting with integrity and due diligence
Identifying operational improvements and finding solutions by applying CI tools and techniques
Responsible for completing tasks and transactions within agreed KPI's
To support and administer HR shared services activities and deliver within agreed SLA on TAT and Accuracy
Knows and applies fundamental work theories/concepts/processes in own areas of work
Manage reporting as well as query management
Good working relationship with teams within and outside People Operations; with stakeholders
To answer all queries promptly; accurately and deliver a great customer service


Qualifications

Basic MS Office – Excel; Word

Eye-to-Detail

Speed and Accuracy

Planning and Organising

Basic Numeracy skills

Additional Information

Hiring Manager- Shwetha Ashok

Last Date of Application- 29th Nov 2022

Important Notice:

On behalf of Tesco Bengaluru, we must caution all job seekers and educational institutions that Tesco Bengaluru does not authorise any third parties to release employment offers or conduct recruitment drives via a third party. Hence, beware of inauthentic and fraudulent job offers or recruitment drives from any individuals or websites purporting to represent Tesco. Further, Tesco Bengaluru does not charge any fee or other emoluments for any reason (including without limitation, visa fees) or seek compensation from educational institutions to participate in recruitment events.

Accordingly, please check the authenticity of any such offers before acting on them and where acted upon, you do so at your own risk. Tesco Bengaluru shall neither be responsible for honouring or making good the promises made by fraudulent third parties, nor for any monetary or any other loss incurred by the aggrieved individual or educational institution.

In the event that you come across any fraudulent activities in the name of Tesco Bengaluru, please feel free report the incident at recruitment_compliance_india@tesco.com

data.description:
Ryanair are currently recruiting for a HR Generalist to join Europe’s Largest Airline Group.

HR at Ryanair can vary quite a bit! The HR Team are on hand to support our 20,000+ aviation professionals across our growing European network.

The HR Officers & Generalists deal with a broad range HR issues and administration, from legal cases to drafting contracts and all the stuff in between, while travelling frequently to your assigned bases to meet with employees and answer an queries they may have. At Ryanair you will gain vast experience very early in your career as you are entrusted and expected to act like a HR Manager for the 1000+ employees under your remit to make daily decisions, offer advice and resolve all employee relations matters that arise.

Ryanair are looking for a HR Generalist to join our Personnel team in a fast paced and challenging department based in Airside Business Park Swords.

Duties Include:

Managing the entire HR function for 1000+ employees in your bases
Monitoring employee absence and turnover to identify trends and deal with same.
Liaising, supporting and advising management at all levels across the business on all HR related matters, ranging from general queries, grievances to disciplinary investigations and legal case preparation.
Maintain the HR databases to ensure all files and the HR system is up to date and accurate.
Weekly reporting to the HR Manager on all HR issues in your area
Contract, payroll & reference etc. administration.
Good knowledge of business and HR model to answer daily employee queries and make informed decisions.
Excellent writing skills to be able to compose important disciplinary etc. letters.
Working on ad hoc projects as and when they arise.
Legal case preparation for local litigation across Europe and for WRC & LC.
Travelling across Europe to meet with employees on general employment matters, attend interviews and employee negotiations.


Requirements

HR degree or masters essential
1-2 years experience in a similar role
Ability to work in a pressurised and fast paced environment
Strong organisational skills
Strong interpersonal skills
The ability to work on own initiative
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
The ability to work under tight deadlines effectively and efficiently
PC Skills (Word, Excel, Power point etc)


Benefits

Competitive Salary and Travel Benefits

data.description:
What you will be doing:

Spend majority of the time engaging with customers directly to
provide technical solutions and productize DRIVE and AI platforms.
Document requirements, designs, and solutions, organize training
sessions, demonstrate new technologies, and drive adoption across teams
working on autonomous driving.
Embed in Autonomous Vehicle teams and cloud platform teams and
deeply understand AV needs and the deep learning platforms on a
technical level. Use this expertise to onboard NVIDIA customers and
partners onto the AV platforms.
Craft solutions for the next generation of software 2.0 development
and debugging platform using real and synthetic / simulated datasets for
autonomous driving.
Analyze complex technical issues and build, develop, and deploy
reusable, generalized, and customized solutions that integrate our AI
platform.
Deliver rapid iterations of software based on user feedback and
metrics.
Build scalable distributed systems, compute and data pipelines, and
web applications that help index, mine, transform, analyze, develop, and
debug deep learning datasets and applications.
Collaborate across org boundaries with a diverse set of hardware and
software engineers.
Showcase your creativity and technical excellence to realize the
future of self-driving cars!

What we need to see:

Bachelors or Masters in Computer Architecture, Computer Science,
Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, or related field.
5+ years of proven experience in designing and developing production
level and enterprise scale software that includes distributed backend
systems and web application development.
5+ years of prior experience deploying, upgrading, migrating, and
driving user adoption of sophisticated enterprise scale systems.
Proven software and solutions development background and proven
ability demonstrate complex new technologies.
Strong problem solving and debugging skills.
You possess advanced programming skills to build debug and tune
distributed storage and compute systems, Linux internals, backend
services, microservices, web technologies.
Strong programming skills with hands-on coding expertise.
A specialist programmer in Go, Scala, C/C++, Python, or equivalent.
Strong programming background that incorporates methodologies like
data structures, design patterns, OOP, and test driven development.
Well versed in agile methodology.
Comfortable with a customer focused and high paced environment that
includes dealing with ambiguity.
Highly motivated with strong interpersonal skills, you have the
ability to work successfully with multi-functional teams, principles and
architects and coordinate effectively across organizational boundaries
and geographies.

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

A go getter attitude to dive deeper and understand technical
requirements.
Experience with autonomous vehicles' domain, standards, and
processes.
Practice with Python SDKs, Python packaging, cross language bindings
(C++/Python) and/or the Bazel build system.
Experience in working with complex software systems on Linux.
Strong understanding of Docker and orchestration systems such as
Kubernetes.
Enthusiasm to collaborate and build supporting development
infrastructure like CI/CD and DevOps.

With highly competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package,
NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology industry's most
desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and hardworking
people in the world working with us and our engineering teams are
growing fast in some of the hottest state of the art fields: Deep
Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Autonomous Vehicles. If you're a
creative computer scientist/engineer with a real passion for distributed
systems and autonomous driving, we want to hear from you.

Work experience as an HR Analyst or similar role

Familiarity with HR operations including hiring, payroll and employee benefits

data.title: Talent Operations Analyst
data.description:
Company Description

Block is one company built from many blocks, all united by the same purpose of economic empowerment. The blocks that form our foundational teams — People, Finance, Counsel, Hardware, Information Security, Platform Infrastructure Engineering, and more — provide support and guidance at the corporate level. They work across business groups and around the globe, spanning time zones and disciplines to develop inclusive People policies, forecast finances, give legal counsel, safeguard systems, nurture new initiatives, and more. Every challenge creates possibilities, and we need different perspectives to see them all. Bring yours to Block.

Job Description

Our talent team is in scaling mode, which requires talent operations to partner with agility and creativity. We're on a mission to hire stunning colleagues throughout EMEA, and looking to refine our talent tech stack to ensure that we're able to do just that.

We are looking for a Talent Operations Analyst to partner with our EMEA TA team, while also extending support to our APAC region. You will focus on building workflows, supporting technical projects (implementations, migrations, enhancements), and also providing tier-zero support to our EMEA talent acquisition team.

You Will

Team player - You support the team with multiple tools/vendors and assist the team with training to help them be effective. This includes understanding business processes and developing workflows that consider user experience and scalability. You'll be nimble as systems and workflows swiftly change.
Problem solver - You're able to research and resolve any problem that comes your way with recommendations or creative solutions, maintaining a people-first mindset. This could be system limitations (ATS), developing new workflows, troubleshooting bugs or issues and facilitating escalation or resources to resolve challenges.
Data literate - You'll work with cross-functional teams to maintain our systems in order to support data entry, access, integrity, and workflows and conduct regular audits. This could be job postings, requisitions, candidates, hires, headcount, etc. You're able to pull ad hoc reports and provide clean data and insights to partnering teams.
Systems experienced - You have experience in an operations role and have a passion for solving complex problems with both human and technical solutions. You balance user requirements, technical specs, and project timelines to support new projects and maintain existing tools/integrations.

You Have

Qualifications

Communication: Need to listen to end-users and know when to present solutions vs. tabling topics to research further before providing suggestions.
Curiosity: Lead by seeking to understand and have an ability to connect the dots.
Acumen: Need to be passionate about understanding and giving feedback to/from the team.
Able to work in a gray world, pivot quickly, and arise to the demands or unknowns we are challenged with. Willing to lean into areas that are less defined or not yet defined.
4+ years of experience within Talent Operations

Additional Information

We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, based solely on the core competencies required of the role at hand, and without regard to any legally protected class.

We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page.

Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

Liaise with payroll provider, Finance department, benefits providers, and team members as necessary

General HR Operations

First point of contact for all HR related queries, providing superior customer service to all team members in line with global service level agreements
Manage a number of employee lifecycle changes through our HR system Workday
Manage HR administration including letter requests, invoicing, reporting etc.
Manage 1st level employee relations issues to successful conclusion and escalate where necessary

data.description:
A new and exciting opportunity has arisen to join our Human Resources team as a HR Data and Reporting Analyst. Utilising our Human Capital Management System, Workday, the Data and Reporting Analyst will play a key role in further developing and growing the teams reporting capability. The role will also offer the opportunity to undertake data analysis and provide insights on data findings.

The HR Data and Reporting Analyst role will sit within the HRIS team and provide Workday Reporting support in key functional areas, including but not limited to; Workday Recruiting, Learning, HCM, Diversity, Compensation, Performance and Talent. The successful candidate will work closely with key business stakeholders to identify reporting needs and produce datasets to assist Leaders make informed decisions with accurate and real time data.

Main Responsibilities:

Generate Workday reports, identifying the best report designs to deliver information and data trends for key metrics
Present data findings and insights to inform and assist with decision making
Liaise with internal stakeholders to identify ongoing reporting requirements and provide data in relation to ad-hoc requests as needed
Maintain and modify reporting configuration within Workday as required
Maintain reporting and data security access on Workday at all times
Investigate, test and resolve reporting issues that may arise
Identify where additional reporting platforms such as PBI may suit reporting requests in conjunction with outputs from our Human Capital Management System
Continually increase knowledge, and maintain individual development of the Workday reporting function through training and research
Perform testing activities of Workday during upgrades or the introduction of new features/enhancements
Support and participate as a project team member in ongoing Workday and wider HR team projects


Skills and Attributes:

2-3 years’ experience in a reporting role, Workday experience required
Third level qualification, preferably in HR or other related discipline
Keen interest in the area of technology/HR technology
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
Strong analytical thinking and attention to detail
Demonstrated ability to work on own initiative and as part of a wider team
Excellent administration skills with strong working knowledge of MS Office packages (Word, Excel and PowerPoint)
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
High levels of professionalism and integrity
Excellent organisational and time management skills with the ability to prioritise

data.description:
Job Title: HR Group Analyst




Reports to: HR Business Partner




Location: Atlantic Aviation Group Hangar 2, Shannon Airport, Shannon, Co Clare




Apply: Email your up-to-date CV together with any supporting qualifications to careers@atlanticaviation.ie




__________________________________________________________________________________




Atlantic Aviation Group




With over 60 years of experience, Shannon based Atlantic Aviation Group (AAG) is one of Europe’s leading independent aviation solution providers. The company has a strong reputation of providing customers with a complete range of solutions including aircraft maintenance & modifications, technical, engineering and design services, logistics and material solutions and international training. This reputation is built on a proud history and tradition of superior craftsmanship, technical expertise, and continuous training, which is supported by our flexible, open, and partnership-based customer relationships.




The company provides a range of aviation solutions including Part 145 Aircraft Maintenance, MAA Part 145 Aircraft Maintenance (AAG Defence Services), CAMO & Technical Services, Part 21 Design Services and EASA Part 147 Training which provides aviation training to airlines, MROs, and companies around the world.




AAG have an exceptional opportunity for a highly motivated career focused and ambitious HR Group Analyst seeking a role in a challenging, fast-paced and rewarding environment. Our aim as a team is to attract and develop key talent across all levels of our growing aviation business.




Duties and responsibilities are, but not limited to the following:




General Responsibility




Atlantic Aviation Group are in the process of upgrading their ERP System. This new role is designed to support the HR team in the transition, bedding down and future vision of this multi generation project plan. The HR Group analyst will be accountable for processing Time and Attendance (T&A), Payroll, Data Analytics and will be an expert user of the ERP Human Capital Management function. This position will serve as a technical point of contact for assigned functional areas and assists subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and analysing data flows for process improvement opportunities.




Initially, the role will focus on migrating the current T&A processing to the ERP and supporting the transition to outsourced payroll provider for AAG-H2.




The role will be responsible for supporting HR by generating meaningful HR metrics and reporting. This data analysis will support HR and the business in crucial decision-making and support the streamlining of T&A, HR and payroll admin processes in a post ERP environment becoming an expert user of the ERP Human Capital Management module.




This role will support HR in establishing high-quality standards for all activities, initiatives, and tasks within area of responsibility and establishing appropriate service level agreements (SLAs) as part of the team.




Essential Job Function




Support the transition to the ERP and future state from AAG’s inhouse systems Wings/T&A and SAP.
Ensure AAG-H2 are prepared to move to outsourced fortnightly payroll when appropriate and supporting the transition when this happens in collaboration with Finance.
Participate as a project team member in ongoing HR/payroll team projects.
Maintain reporting and data security access, ERP and other data.
Provides support to ERP – HCM users and stakeholders within the HR, Payroll, and IT teams as well as to end users (employees and managers).
Supports security configuration to ensure appropriate control of access to data and system.
Manage maintenance and accuracy and integrity of employee data, for reporting and distribution.
Recommends and creates data auditing reports and procedures to ensure the accuracy of all HR data.
Accountable for specific HR initiatives and projects as assigned.
Generate reports to deliver information and data trends for key metrics.
Present data findings and insights to inform and assist with decision making.
Liaise with internal stakeholders to identify ongoing reporting requirements and provide data in relation to ad-hoc requests as needed.
Manage a small team as role develops over time




Candidate Requirements




Degree qualified in Business or Informatics
Microsoft Suite Familiarity and Tech Savvy
Excellent interpersonal, collaboration skills and ability to build relationships
Ability and willingness to work a Flexible schedule when role demands same
Experience in a similar role processing T&A processing, payroll and HR data in a large organisation where there is a high level of automation.




Typical Working Conditions




Must satisfy and maintain the required medical standard.
Work is performed at the AAG Hangar in Shannon.
PPE is provided by AAG, and its use is mandatory in the performance of your work.
Must satisfy and maintain airport security requirements.
Agile




We will question the norm, seek out opportunity and embrace change for the better.




Ambitious




We will dream big and pursue those dreams with passion and determination.




Committed to Excellence




We will always strive to be better, to be different, to Go Beyond.




Customer Centric




We will build honest, personal relationships with our customers and aim to wow them.




Fun




We’ll have fun while getting the job done and ensure a positive and happy workplace.




People Focused




We will develop, engage, protect, and support our staff and each other.




Trust




We will create trust by being honest, ethical, and respectful every day. What we say is what we do.




Closing Date




If you feel your skills and experience meet the requirements of this position, we look forward to hearing from you!




Closing date for applications: 16/12/2022




Atlantic Aviation Group reserves the right to close the role prior to this date should a suitable applicant be found.




Equal Opportunities Employer




Atlantic Aviation Group is an equal opportunities employer. The people of Atlantic Aviation Group are the foundation of its success, and we believe that employing a diverse workforce is key to this success. As an equal opportunity employer, we will consider all suitably qualified applicants regardless of nationality, religion, ethnic origin, gender identity or expression, religion or beliefs, age, sexual orientation, or disability. We value your passion, energy, and creativeness.




One of our company values is to provide a people focussed environment with a strong sense of community, where individuals feel safe, valued, and engaged. We are committed to accommodating individuals with disabilities through our recruitment process and encourage any candidates to tell us about any adjustment requirements.




Agencies




Atlantic Aviation Group does not accept unsolicited CVs from 3rd party recruitment agencies without a written agreement in place. Atlantic Aviation Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited CVs and no fee will be paid should the candidate be hired by Atlantic Aviation Group.




Data Privacy




By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.

Job Description




As a key member of the People & Places Total Rewards team, the Sr Total Rewards Analyst will provide support to Total Rewards activities and participate in initiatives that will have a real impact on supporting an evolving business.




The successful candidate in this role should enjoy highly analytical work and problem solving in a dynamic environment, and not be afraid to independently prioritize multiple assignments. Responsibilities




Conduct data analysis and generate meaningful insights to drive pay decisions and program design

Conduct market studies and analysis on compensation data and pay practices that advise internal pay policies and practices

Support in the development and maintenance of pay ranges
Participate in different Total Rewards projects

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent industry experience

Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and attention to detail
Capacity to work collaboratively and take initiative in a quickly growing environment
Ability to be solution oriented and help tackle problems, make complex / broken processes more effective and deliver creative fixes to nuanced issues
High proficiency with Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets
Workday experience a plus

Full ownership of the projects you work on

data.title: HR Data Analyst (12 mth FTC)
data.description:
We are looking for a collaborative, inquisitive, and analytical professional like you to fulfill the role of HR Data Analyst on a 12 month Fixed Term contract , within the PGIM Global Human Resources Compensation and Analytics team. You will have the opportunity to work with colleagues from around the world and gain exposure to HR data and practices across different geographies. You will support solutions for PGIM’s dynamic business strategy and manage established HR analytical processes. Responsibilities include working with internal partners and clients to execute initiatives and creatively solve PGIM people-related data and compensation challenges. The incumbent will assist with fulfilling reporting requests from through the organization, including headcount and diversity metrics. In addition, this role will support the HR year-end rewards process. The ideal candidate will partner with PGIM HR colleagues to design, produce and update a wide variety of reports in both Excel and Power BI, and fulfill ad-hoc requests.

Your Impact:

Manage ad-hoc requests and provide day-to-day reporting, analytics and compensation support to HR business partners and business clients, including providing HR data for Request for Proposal (RFP) questionnaires
Support and execute year-end reward processes across PGIM businesses including compensation, promotions, and performance management
Support implementation of PGIM compensation application, including testing and transition
Take a proactive and consultative approach, ask the right questions to understand stakeholder needs, develop an understanding of all PGIM businesses and partner across teams to solve data-related challenges


Your Required Skills:

Curious and creative; develop innovative approaches to solving data-related challenges and improve ways of working
Excellent analytical and data analysis skills; the ability to tell a story and derive insight from analysis to impact business decisions
Technical skills:
Strong Microsoft Excel (VBA, VLOOKUP, SUMIFs, Nesting, Power Pivot Tables, Charts)
Exposure to Power BI and/or other data analytics/visualization tools and willingness to increase skill level will be beneficial - we can provide training and support with these.
Experience leveraging technical skills to build and efficiently manage data collection from multiple sources.
Experience producing executive-ready reports, dashboards, and presentations to influence decision making around people-related strategies.
Accuracy and attention to detail, balanced with the ability to see the big picture.
Excellent work ethic and self-motivated; able to manage work in a high-volume, fast paced environment, juggle multiple priorities and flexibility to work extended hours as needed.
Ideally you would have a minimum of 2 – 3 years of experience in Human Resources analytics and/or compensation
Bachelor’s Degree


Your Desired Skills:

Financial services industry, asset management, and/or global experience
Experience with the Prudential Human Resources application (Workday) and/or HR Compensation applications
Experience with Microsoft Access and Microsoft PowerPoint


Working at PGIM

In joining PGIM you’ll be working in an organisation where your work and efforts are recognised and you will be encouraged and enabled to develop and succeed. Employee Benefits include:

Health Insurance
Defined Contribution Pension Scheme
Hybrid working environment
Employee wellbeing programmes
Tuition Reimbursement and access to online learning platforms.
Employee recognition programme
Excellent work-life balance

About PGIM Human Resources: Through our advising, we balance business, employee, and corporate needs, ensuring practices and processes are both fair and reasonable. Additionally, we lead and implement a variety of company-wide initiatives that support our strategic objectives. Through these efforts, we support PGIM in sustaining its competitive advantage in the marketplace.

data.description:
Overview

JD Fashion Plc is a leading international multi-channel retailer of branded sports, fashion, and outdoor brands. Established in 1981 with a single store in the North-West of England, today JD is an industry leading retail business with over 60,000 colleagues and over 3,400 stores across a number of retail fascias in 32 markets around the world. JD is at the pinnacle of the global sports fashion industry, providing customers with a product range that remains both authentic and uniquely appealing across a highly differentiated omni-channel experience.

Our business model is split into Sports Fashion, Street & Premium Fashion, Outdoors and Gyms.

JD Sports Fashion Plc was listed on the London Stock Exchange in 1996 and has been a FTSE100 publicly quoted company since 2019. In FY21, JD Sports Fashion Plc generated revenues of £6,167.3m, underlying PBT of £324.0m and net cash of £795.4m and a market capitalisation of £7.275bn.

JD won the International Excellence award at the Drapers Awards 2021 and was named best performing share of the 2010s with revenues increasing from £770m in 2010 to £6.1bn in 2021.

role overview

Advance the People Teams impact by delivering a full HRIS programme within a cluster of European countries aimed at positioning JD as an employer of choice.

The JD People team puts the colleague at the heart of what we do to develop a level of service that emulates the JD brand and maximises colleague experience.

We are looking for an ambitious and eager individual to supporting the designing and implementing of complex, high profile HRIS implementations. The role key objective will be to support in implementing overarching global design principles, with essential changes for local territory requirements.

This role is hands-on and candidates must be capable of working to multiple directions in key deadlines. To support the design of system functions and processes with the ability to configure system infrastructure to deliver requirements alongside the management of multinational teams and other key supporting roles. The successful candidate will need to be process-driven, highly analytical and organised.

A successful candidate should possess a good track record in a HR/ Workforce or Pay environment and can applying their knowledge of one or more areas of the People function to support the resolution of complex challenges.

key duties/responsibilities

Help implement the design a systemic solution to best suit the Groups requirements
Support the delivery of the confirguration and Implemention of a HRIS solution across European countries.
Support testing processes and training and communication drafting
Have a passion for providing quality, security and accuracy
Deliver impeccable service to the wider People Team and wider business
Support the design, build and test integrations between HR solution and other product workstreams.
Coordinate your team for the following activities: Compliance, SKU Testing, BAU Changes, Global Design templates and more

Skills/experience/knowledge Needed

Previous experience in a HR/WFM or Pay field essential
Ability to work under own initiative essential
Previous experience in deploying HRIS solutions across multiple territories beneficial
Ability to work on own initiative as well as part of a team.
Effective communication skills both written and oral
Confident and courteous in dealing with internal and external stakeholders
Prominent level of attention to detail with strong administrative and organisational skills and be able to prioritise your own and your team’s workload
Must be methodical and be able to work to strict deadlines.
Have an awareness of GDPR and be able to act with absolute discretion and confidentiality
Ambitious to learn with an enthusiastic approach
Successful candidate must have valid passport and be able to travel internationally
what can we offer you?

As a business, JD puts people at the centre. Through the JD foundation colleagues can take part in charity volunteering opportunities. The business supports your wellbeing through our departmental wellbeing champions, and health and wellbeing events and initiatives. Our employee forum also gives you a voice to tell us what’s important to you and how we can support you.

Alongside that, we offer competitive benefits, including; staff discount at JD and selected fascias, discounted JD gym membership, 28 days holiday (inclusive of bank holidays) increasing with each year of service, up to 33days, hybrid working, pension scheme, free onsite secure parking, unlimited fruit, tea and coffee and an onsite subsidised canteen.

JD values diversity and inclusion and champions a culture where everyone feels, valued, included and celebrated.

Role: HR Analyst (Part-time)




Location: Remote Working/UK Wide Opportunities. Candidates need the flexibility to visit one of our UK sites if required e.g. Harlow, Glenrothes, Manchester, Broughton, Gloucester etc




Summary Of Role




The HR Analyst will deliver high quality service to support the UK wide HR function and the wider business through various activities which includes updating HR Systems, data analysis, reporting, metrics and HR operational tasks as required. The role will be part-time, with a term time working pattern considered.




Main Duties:




Working with the HR Shared Services team on a range of tasks to support the various HR teams, Talent Acquisition team and wider business employees.
Provide metrics to HR, Recruitment, Learning & Development etc when required.
Work with HR Analysts and HR teams on various HR and data tasks.
Support payroll and compensation and benefits teams.
Produce metrics/data for various reports e.g. recruitment, L&D, benefits, performance reviews, training, etc as per HR and business requirements.
Escalate issues to the HR Shared Services Manager.
Process visas and answer queries relating to visas.
Review/approve HR transactions in Workday.
Support the Talent Acquisition team with operational tasks including, booking interviews, candidate communications and vacancy tracking and reporting of contractor headcount
Administrative tasks to support HR.
Interpret and process complex data and produce clear reports for a range of HR/business requests.
Support on-boarding activities and HR administration.
Adhere to HR policies, governance, process and procedures.
Update Excel spreadsheets and edit Excel spreadsheets for reports (e.g. using data entry, formatting tools, pivot tables etc).
Act as a data/metrics, reward and visa HR point of contact




Candidate Requirements




Essential:




Experience of using HR Information Systems
Experience of running analytics and reports from HR Information systems
Experience of working closely with payroll teams to maintain data accuracy
Intermediate or Advanced Microsoft Office skills, including Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
Experience of analysing data and generating a report
Ability to work with challenging and disparate data sources
Ability to spot opportunities for improvement and implement changes
Understanding of HR processes and procedures
Previous similar experience in a HR team working with metrics, reporting, operations, processing visas, HR processes, data and HR systems.




Desirable:




A CIPD / HR qualification or working towards.
Knowledge of salary sacrifice benefits provisions
Knowledge of global mobility within HR
Compensation and benefits or reward analyst experience
Experience of Workday




About Raytheon UK




With facilities in Broughton, Waddington, Glenrothes, Harlow, Gloucester, Manchester and a presence across customer sites together with remote working practices. Raytheon UK is invested in the British workforce and the development of UK technology. Across the country Raytheon UK employs over 2,000 people and supports 8,000 jobs. As a prime contractor and major supplier to the UK Ministry of Defence, Raytheon continues to invest in research and development, supporting innovation and technological advances across its core mission areas Weapons & Sensors, and Cyber, Space & Training.




Raytheon UK is a landed company, part of the Raytheon Technologies organisation and sits within the Raytheon Intelligence & Space business.




About Raytheon Technologies




Raytheon Technologies Corporation is an aerospace and defence company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises four industry-leading businesses – Collins Aerospace Systems, Pratt & Whitney, Raytheon Intelligence & Space and Raytheon Missiles & Defence. It’s 195,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cyber security. The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts.




Raytheon Career Development:




Raytheon has a wealth of resources available to help you develop your career from the moment you join. Activities range from on-line learning modules, to external training and support for taking professional qualifications relevant to your role.




Standard Benefits:




25 days holiday (increasing to 27 days) + statutory public holidays.
Contributory Pension Scheme (up to 10.5% company contribution).
6 times salary ‘Life Assurance’.
Flexible Benefits scheme.
Discretionary Bonus scheme.
Enhanced family friendly policies.
37hr standard working week, with an early finish on Fridays whilst operating a ‘Hybrid Working Model’*
Canteen facilities are available at Harlow & Glenrothes sites. Manchester & Gloucester offer free snacks & drinks (hot & cold).
Our Hybrid Working Model supports flexible working arrangements on a formal or informal arrangement, considering both location and/or working hours, subject to business and customer needs. Please highlight any flexible requirements to our Recruitment team to explore the opportunities.




Diversity, Equity and Inclusion:




At Raytheon UK, we’re committed to be building a workforce that represents the true diversity of Britain where all of our colleagues feel enabled to deliver the best work of their lives. We’re proud to be an equal opportunities employer who selects the very best candidates for the job. We truly value the diversity of our workforce work hard to create an inclusive environment where our colleagues can bring the unique skills, experiences and ideas to the table to help us grow our business, create innovative solutions and develop our people.




Our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) act as the eyes and ears into the community they represent and support us in building a truly inclusive business. Our ERGs are open to all colleagues, regardless of background, and include: Raytheon Women’s Network, RayPride, Young Employees Success Network, Raytheon Veterans Network, Raytheon Alliance for Diverse Abilities and RayBAME.




We’re also delighted to have been recognised as a Gold Award Employer as part of the HM’s Armed Forces Covenant and the Human Rights Campaign’s 2021 Corporate Equality Index as a ‘best place to work for LGBTQ Equality’.




All applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other characteristic.




If you need us to make any adjustments to support you during our recruitment process, speak to our recruitment team who will be happy to help.

Facilitate clear and concise status updates including direct communications with HRIS Team and project sponsors

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.

Proficiency in Workday in one or more functional areas, ideally Absence & Time Tracking, Advanced Compensation or Security.

Organized, detail oriented with strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to present data in a polished, professional form (e.g., executive dashboards, PowerPoint presentations)
MS Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Intermediate Excel (VLOOKUP, pivots, etc.) skills
Must work well independently with minimal direction, but also enjoy working as part of a global team
Ability to balance multiple projects and shifting priorities

Great Company Culture. We pride ourselves as being one of the most creative and innovative places to work, creativity, innovation, efficiency, diversity and philanthropy are among the core tenets of our organization and are integral drivers of our continued success.

Work Hard, Play Hard. Our employees’ bond, blow-off steam, and flex some creative muscles – through corporate boot camp classes, our onsite Gym, company parties, our Office bar, game release events, monthly socials, and team challenges.
Benefits. Benefits include, but are not limited to Private healthcare, Private dental, A double matching pension policy where the employer will double match up to a 4% contribution from the employee, Employee stock purchase scheme with a 15% discount, Eye tests and vouchers towards glasses, Cycle to work scheme, Flu vouchers, Annual health, 4X death in service insurance, Income protection (66% salary), Workplace Savings, 26 days holiday, Enhanced Family friendly policies + other great perks and great office facilities!
Perks. Fitness reimbursement up to £50 per month, an onsite Gym, an Office bar, employee discount programs, free games & events, stocked pantries, a dog friendly workplace and the ability to earn £350+ per year for taking care of yourself and more!

data.title: Talent Acquisition Data Analyst
data.description:
Are you a motivated, hands-on Data Analyst who is looking to change your game?




Expleo is offering a great opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst in search of joining a global vision in supporting the transformation of the reporting landscape within Talent Acquisition and enable the team to deliver high-quality analysis efficiently and on time.




People are at the center of everything we do, be it our employees, candidates or clients. We focus all our energy providing the best experience. Recruiting data and insights are key to us understanding how we can continuously improve our candidate journey. The Talent Acquisition Data Analyst role plays an integral part in helping us understand our recruiting metrics to make informed decisions.




Be bold. Apply now!




Responsibilities




Build and maintain required dashboards and visualizations to show results at a glance
Provide monthly, quarterly and annual global talent acquisitions reports for the Executive Committee based on key metrics and KPIS
Create new reports within our global recruitment tool iCIMS for users based on business needs
Partner closely with the business and our global IT team to ensure a high degree of data accuracy is maintained at all times
Identify data issues and implement corrective actions to ensure data accuracy is maintained
Safeguard Expleo’s data by implementing the relevant data protection policies
Create, refine, and automate reporting tools / models / dashboards that provide analysis and insight into KPIs
Deal with ad-hoc insights requests and queries




In addition, you will take responsibility for all periodic reporting. The aim is to improve and automate regular management reporting formats, allowing for timely and transparent reporting on the most relevant KPIs as well as ensuring data accuracy is maintained. The successful candidate has strong analytical skills, is motivated to get things done, shows a hands-on approach, and is keen on working in an international team.




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree in a data-related field or a combination of education and experience.




Skills




Good communication and stakeholder Management.
Attention to detail, and analytical thinking
Confident knowledge of corporate organization, management, and applied analytics.
Significant personal initiative and tenacity both when working alone or as a member of a team.
Ability to review and analyze data and compile detailed professional and investigative reports.
Ability to operate in a global multicultural environment.




Experience




4-6 years of experience with Data Analytics, Data Visualization, and technology such as Power BI and Excel.
Prior experience in Recruitment and or Human Resources is a plus.




Benefits




Why Join Us




Expleo is a trusted partner for end-to-end, integrated engineering, quality services and management consulting for digital transformation. We are a talent incubator. The time you spend at Expleo will turbo-charge your career, allowing you to work on complex technical challenges, enjoy opportunities to expand your skills and take part in inspiring, multi-disciplinary collaborations with your colleagues. Let’s change the game together. To find out more, visit www.expleo.com




We Offer




Professional and Dynamic work setting
Opportunity to grow within organization




Expleo Values




We are guided by shared values in all things we do: Courage, Excellence, Collaboration, Respect and Accountability.




Courage – We are bold thinkers and doers, always ready to take on new challenges. We think of ourselves as entrepreneurs, matching creativity with vigilance.
Excellence – We are united by a shared ambition: change the game, together. Continuous performance is both an objective and a mindset.
Collaboration –Teamwork and emotional intelligence are what makes us stand out in a crowd. We stand shoulder to shoulder, with our clients and our peers, through good times and setbacks.
Respect – We are a hive of different profiles, and we place a high value on openness and transparency. We show respect, always.
Accountability – We are reliable. We celebrate our successes; we take responsibility and learn from our failures. This is why we protect our “right to fail” as an opportunity to bounce back and progress.

HR Analyst




We’re hiring!




The HR team are recruiting for an HR Analyst based in London with the opportunity to work from home in a hybrid fashion.




As a member of the global HR team, you will assist with smooth running of the department by ensuring that a comprehensive professional HR, Payroll and Benefits service is provided to our clients whilst developing HR analytics to drive organisational development aligned to the business objectives.




This role has a broad remit and is a great opportunity to grow your career in a global, delivery focused, pro-active HR team.




About BMS

BMS is a dynamic, independent global broker established in 1980, delivering specialist insurance, reinsurance, and capital markets advisory services. Our purpose is to help people, businesses and communities flourish and prosper in a world of risk.

We are a global brand with offices located across the US, Canada, Latin America, Australia, Europe and Asia with both a strong local focus and understanding of market needs. Being independent gives our brokers the freedom to deliver the best solutions and combined with our collaborative team approach, single platform worldwide and renowned personal service, we are the independent broker of choice.




Key responsibilities of the HR Analyst:

HRIS

Assist with the implementation and launch of new Global HRIS platform, ensuring viable interfaces with other HR platforms
‘Super user’ for the HR system, and the point of contact for the system provider. Work to ensure the system remains fit for purpose, developing functionality, supporting new module rollout and opportunities for system enhancement, and work closely with line managers and other key HR system users to develop their knowledge and use of the system
Ensure all data entered into the HRIS is accurate and up to date, auditing regularly
Liaise with HR Administration team to create and implement HRIS workflows as appropriate, in line with the employee lifecycle
Create and maintain user guides for the HRIS and other HR systems including regular training sessions

Management Information

Accurately produce all required HR data reports, displayed in appropriate formats, in agreed timeframes. This includes the production of recurrent and ad hoc HR data metrics and dashboards
Support the Head of HR & Global HRD with the production of annual Gender pay gap data and report
Assist the Global HRD with preparation and submission of the quarterly culture dashboard and key HR metrics
Prepare the monthly recruitment activity report and headcount reports for Finance and Head of HR
Liaise with HRBP’s and internal business units to obtain required data

Payroll & Benefits Administration

Provide timely processing of accurate UK payroll information to outsourced managed payroll providers, including checking of payroll input
Support HRBPs with the preparation of the International payrolls where required
Action all UK & International post payroll activities, including issuing P45s, administration of pension schedules and reconciliation
Assist with the co-ordination of the annual reward process
Oversee Benefit in Kind Reporting (P11ds) and International office equivalent
Provide accurate and timely Directors’ Emolument data as required
Prepare and upload the monthly benefit report to the benefit system
Assist with the annual review of the benefits system
Provide support with the administration and queries relating to employee benefit schemes, including the annual review process, pension, medical insurance, PHI and other elements of remuneration, liaising with external intermediaries as appropriate

Project Management

Provide project management support and HR expertise to the business with specific related projects
Work with Global HR Team on specific projects as appropriate

Additional Responsibilities

Assist with the culture survey, analysing results and preparing presentations
Work with Head of HR to implement Group wide initiatives
Ensure high quality, accurate, insightful data is produced and maintained, working with the HR Team to ensure this is the case
Deal with requests for information, and create ad hoc reports for the team, employees, and management as required
Be the HR system lead, working with the external service providers to ensure the system is usable for all employees, and updates/improvements are developed and implemented when required
Prepare and submit Office for National Statistic (ONS) questionnaires
Consistently engage with internal stakeholders to be main point of contact for HR data requests
Collate business dashboard reporting, analysing the data, highlighting key areas, and predicting trends for discussion, working with the HR Business Partners and the Head of HR
Collate and monitor data for annual benchmarking purposes, using external providers as and where required
Work with Global HR Team to provide administrative improvements and bespoke tools that drive
efficiencies and improve reporting
Comply with the requirements of GDPR, FCA requirement, Company’s Rules and Procedures and other management instructions




What we are looking for:

Experience of working within an HR Administration or Analytics role
Basic knowledge of human resources disciplines and procedures
Practical application of the Microsoft office suite
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Proactive and always looking for ways to deliver a better or more efficient service
Ability to quickly learn the organisations software
Excellent attention to detail
Ability to exercise solid judgement particularly when handling confidential information
Personally demonstrate the five BMS values and ensure that team members are aligned with these:
Accountable
Entrepreneurial
Collaborative
Empowering
Disciplined




What’s in it for me?

This role offers a competitive salary and bonus, 27 days holiday, plus access to our personalised benefits platform, Your Rewards, including:

-comprehensive private medical cover for you and your dependents

-complimentary annual health checks

-access to a virtual 24hr GP

-critical illness cover

-gym subsidy & dedicated wellbeing support

-retail discounts

-opportunity to purchase equity

-defined contribution pension




Through our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) vision, we are committed to ‘building a culture of belonging for all, valuing diverse perspectives and embracing authenticity.’ As such, we have created our ‘BMS Together’ programme, with dedicated training, collaborative committees and intentional partnerships. In support of our ESG vision, we offer two additional paid days each year to take part in charitable work.




BMS offers flexible and hybrid working policies and we’re happy to discuss options with you upon application. Please let our team know if you require any adjustments to support you through the application process.




Apply now!

Email a copy of your CV to joinus@bmsgroup.com

data.title: Talent Acquisition Data Analyst
data.description:
Are you a motivated, hands-on Data Analyst who is looking to change your game?

Expleo is offering a great opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst in search of joining a global vision in supporting the transformation of the reporting landscape within Talent Acquisition and enable the team to deliver high-quality analysis efficiently and on time.

People are at the center of everything we do, be it our employees, candidates or clients. We focus all our energy providing the best experience. Recruiting data and insights are key to us understanding how we can continuously improve our candidate journey. The Talent Acquisition Data Analyst role plays an integral part in helping us understand our recruiting metrics to make informed decisions.

Be bold. Apply now!

Responsibilities

Build and maintain required dashboards and visualizations to show results at a glance
Provide monthly, quarterly and annual global talent acquisitions reports for the Executive Committee based on key metrics and KPIS
Create new reports within our global recruitment tool iCIMS for users based on business needs
Partner closely with the business and our global IT team to ensure a high degree of data accuracy is maintained at all times
Identify data issues and implement corrective actions to ensure data accuracy is maintained
Safeguard Expleo’s data by implementing the relevant data protection policies
Create, refine, and automate reporting tools / models / dashboards that provide analysis and insight into KPIs
Deal with ad-hoc insights requests and queries

In addition, you will take responsibility for all periodic reporting. The aim is to improve and automate regular management reporting formats, allowing for timely and transparent reporting on the most relevant KPIs as well as ensuring data accuracy is maintained. The successful candidate has strong analytical skills, is motivated to get things done, shows a hands-on approach, and is keen on working in an international team.




Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a data-related field or a combination of education and experience.




Skills

Good communication and stakeholder Management.
Attention to detail, and analytical thinking
Confident knowledge of corporate organization, management, and applied analytics.
Significant personal initiative and tenacity both when working alone or as a member of a team.
Ability to review and analyze data and compile detailed professional and investigative reports.
Ability to operate in a global multicultural environment.




Experience

4-6 years of experience with Data Analytics, Data Visualization, and technology such as Power BI and Excel.
Prior experience in Recruitment and or Human Resources is a plus.




Why Join Us

Expleo is a trusted partner for end-to-end, integrated engineering, quality services and management consulting for digital transformation. We are a talent incubator. The time you spend at Expleo will turbo-charge your career, allowing you to work on complex technical challenges, enjoy opportunities to expand your skills and take part in inspiring, multi-disciplinary collaborations with your colleagues. Let’s change the game together. To find out more, visit www.expleo.com

We offer:

Professional and Dynamic work setting
Opportunity to grow within organization




Expleo Values

We are guided by shared values in all things we do: Courage, Excellence, Collaboration, Respect and Accountability.

Courage – We are bold thinkers and doers, always ready to take on new challenges. We think of ourselves as entrepreneurs, matching creativity with vigilance.
Excellence – We are united by a shared ambition: change the game, together. Continuous performance is both an objective and a mindset.
Collaboration –Teamwork and emotional intelligence are what makes us stand out in a crowd. We stand shoulder to shoulder, with our clients and our peers, through good times and setbacks.
Respect – We are a hive of different profiles, and we place a high value on openness and transparency. We show respect, always.
Accountability – We are reliable. We celebrate our successes; we take responsibility and learn from our failures. This is why we protect our “right to fail” as an opportunity to bounce back and progress.

data.description:
This position is responsible for development within Oracle Cloud HR Footprint (Fusion HCM / Cloud HCM, Taleo Recruiting/Onboarding, and Fusion Analytics). The individual will propose design and implement the enhancement solution.

Responsibilities

Implements and documents change in the Oracle Cloud HR Footprint (Fusion HCM / Cloud HCM, Taleo Recruiting/Onboarding, and Fusion Analytics) in accordance with the approved SDLC process and development standards.
Assists to complete technical analysis of solution design
Assists to provide impact analysis
Provides Development Estimates on various work request with level of confidence.
L3/L4 Support for problem solving and proposing resolution
May serve as a member of a Major Incident Team
Proactively identifies improvement opportunities

We’re looking for someone who has these abilities and skills:
Understanding / knowledge (4 or more years) in HR Projects & Business Processes / Cycles (i.e. Benefits Open Enrollment)
Development experience (3 or more years) in the Oracle Cloud HR Footprint (Fusion HCM / Cloud HCM, Taleo Recruiting/Onboarding, and Fusion Analytics) is required.
Proven experience in half of the modules in the AXA XL footprint - Core HR, Benefits, Workforce Compensation, Goals/Performance, Talent Review, Succession Planning, Absence, Time & Labor, Recruiting, Onboarding - is required.
Experience building fast formulas for above footprint is preferred.
Experience in the technical creation of OTBI, BIP and Extracts is ideal.
Willingness to expand knowledge into other modules is required.
Ability to collaborate well with others with different skillsets and knowledge on the Oracle Cloud HR Footprint.
Ability to complete application changes on-time, to a target level of quality with the required artifacts to ensure solutions are auditable, testable, and maintainable
Ability to working on multiple projects and change during same time period is required.
Ability to build effective working relationships (Internally/Externally), establishing credibility amongst a wide and demanding client group
Ability to organize self including effective scheduling, prioritization and time management skills, completing tasks to tight deadlines.
Adherence to development governance & SDLC standards set by Application Lead / Application Manager is required.

data.description:
_VOIS:




_VOIS (Vodafone Intelligent Solutions) is a strategic arm of Vodafone Group Plc, creating value and enhancing quality and efficiency across 28 countries, and operating from 6 locations: Albania, Egypt, Hungary, India, Romania, and the UK.




Over 26,000 highly skilled individuals are dedicated to being Vodafone Group’s partner of choice for talent, technology, and transformation. We deliver the best services across IT, Business Intelligence Services, Customer Operations, Business Operations, HR, Finance, Supply Chain, HR Operations, and many more.




Established in 2006, _VOIS has evolved into a global, multi-functional organisation, a Centre of Excellence for Intelligent Solutions focused on adding value and delivering business outcomes for Vodafone.




_VOIS India:




In 2009, _VOIS started operating in India and now has established global delivery centres in Pune, Bangalore and Ahmedabad. With more than 13,000 employees, _VOIS India supports global markets and group functions of Vodafone, and delivers best-in-class customer experience through multi-functional services in the areas of Information Technology, Networks, Business Intelligence and Analytics, Digital Business Solutions (Robotics & AI), Commercial Operations (Consumer & Business), Intelligent Operations, Finance Operations, Supply Chain Operations and HR Operations and more.




_VOIS India Big Data & Analytics Unit:




Part of the Technology & Business Intelligence Units, our Big Data & Analytics unit is a team of 1,000+ global professionals. They work with 23 Vodafone marketsacross the globeand deliver large transformational programs. They support the Technology & Digital strategy for _VOIS by leveraging Data & Insights skills to improve commercial performance & enable our clients to fully embrace a data-driven culture. This amazing team works on Data Engineering, Machine Learning, Cloud Platforms like GCP, AWS, Software engineering, traditional ETL tools like AbInitio, ODI, Talend, and are helping to create Business Insights on top of Data Lakes using Qlik, Tableau, Power BI and these are just to name a few.




Open Roles




Data Engineers: experience 4-8 years
Data Scientists: experience 4-8 years
Data Analysts: experience 8-12 years
Data Architects: experience 15-20 years
Business Intelligence Developer: experience 4-8 years
Business Intelligence Experts: experience 4-8 years
Machine Learning Engineers: experience 4-8 years
Business Intelligence Architects: experience 10-15 years




Key Skills




Python, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Data Analysis, Data Mining, Machine Learning, Data Analytics, SQL, Data Science, Big Data Analytics, Microsoft Power BI, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), PySpark, Machine Learning Algorithms, Ab Initio, Google BigQuery, QlikView, QlikView Development, Qlik Sense, Qlik NPrinting, Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), Data Fusion, Data Flow, Apache Airflow, Cloudera, Scala, Apache Kafka, Kubeflow, Kubernetes, Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE), Amazon EKS, NoSQL and Apache Spark




#_VOIS is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We celebrate differences and we welcome and value diverse people and insights. We believe that being authentically human and inclusive powers our employees’ growth and enables them to create a positive impact for themselves and society. We do not discriminate based upon age, colour, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender identity, gender expression, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

data.title: Data Visualization Engineer
data.description:
IT needs to rapidly evolve to ensure it continues to be recognized for creating and protecting business value, whilst simultaneously managing and balancing business risk. The Information, Data and Analytics (IDA) capability has been established to support project delivery and user support services (application and process) for Management information systems employing reporting, visualization and analytics. IDA is an area which is getting higher attention, stronger recognition from the Business as a key area to support in providing the right tools for the Business to build the right reports/visualizations needed to drive decisions more effectively and rapidly.




Key responsibilities:




Drives clarification of requirements for reports
Integrates business specific needs from a technical solution design perspective and delivers effort estimates for those solutions
Contributes to the development of the Functional Specs from a technical design perspective
Develops reports/visualizations based on technical solution design
Perform Prototyping and POC in support of requirements definition or technical design questions
Execute Unit Test, defect resolution and hyper care




Additional challenges (may) include:




Working through complex interfaces across organizational and geographic boundaries
Working in a fast moving, rapidly changing and dynamic environment
The working days in Bangalore Hub are based on two shifts in order to work in the same time zone that the Projects and Asset we serve. (HR to conform the shift hours) Lead teams and initiatives at project/Capability level to drive estimations, designs, initiatives and outcomes




Requirements:




Several Analytics tools will be used for reporting/visualization by business. Candidates are expected to be passionate about designing and creating meaningful data visualizations and memorable user experiences. Ability to think strategically and communicate data-driven insights by transforming science and numbers into easily understandable visualization is desirable. While the focus stays on bringing out stories from data, it is equally important for the candidate to be proficient in SQL and well-versed with concepts of Data warehousing and Data Modeling so that the candidate can work closely with business to curate and “ready” the data in a form that is conducive to reporting/self-service analytics.




Skills:




Minimum years of experience with reporting/visualization/ analytics tools. Refer table above.
Power BI is a mandatory skill.
Proficiency in SQL, Data Warehousing and Data Modeling concepts is mandatory.
Hands on experience of data modelling in Azure analysis services (AAS) is mandatory.
Knowledge and experience in other Data visualization tools is an added advantage.
Strong data modelling experience using ER diagram, Dimensional data modelling Star schema modelling
Data procurement strategies – DB, Cached/import mode (applications, features and drawbacks) and enabling Row Level Security (RLS)
Performance tuning (pushdown logic, calculated columns and measures, data loading strategies, filtering data, variables)
Development of visualizations and interactivity (Bar Chart, Line Chart, Scatter Plot, Heat maps, combined charts, bookmarks, report interfaces, slicers/filters, themes, animations, etc.)
Experience in User-centered design, wireframing, knowledge of the data visualization concepts, ability to pick the right graphs depending on the context and overall focus on aesthetics is a must.
Knowledge of Power BI cloud, workspaces, gateways, premium capacity, publishing, scheduling, User Access Management is a requisite.
Knowledge of Cloud technologies is preferred.
Experience setting up data connections, mobility, writing functions and using advanced features like ESRI, what-if analysis, forecasting, NLP, scripting, R & python etc. is preferred
Confident communicator, able to express your ideas and convey complicated concepts simply

data.title: Associate, People Analytics
data.description:
What You'll Do




As a People Analyst, you’ll support evidence-based decision making. You’ll provide analytical input to support the Global People team and work with stakeholders across BCG. You’ll add a quantitative perspective to discussions on new and existing HR processes and procedures. You will apply an analytics mindset and empower internal clients with dashboards, data, and reports to help improve processes, and solve people related challenges, to provide thought leadership on the complete cycle of talent analytics, from sourcing and interviewing candidates to managing attrition.




YOU'RE GOOD AT




Providing analytical support in metrics, reporting, and dashboard development
Leading technical aspects of a large project with minimal supervision
Generating insights from large and complex datasets, understanding the nuances and inconsistencies in data
Applying an analytical mindset to propose data-driven solutions
Ability to multi-task and operate effectively in a fast-paced and customer-oriented environment; ability to manage multiple stakeholders in a matrix organization
Communicating and presenting technical details to non-technical stakeholders
Strong interpersonal skills, who showcases credibility and excels in a collaborative setting




You Bring (experience & Qualifications)




Undergraduate degree, preferably in an engineering or other technology-related fields, with high academic achievement required; advanced degree preferred 
2-5 years of full time Tableau Desktop development, data modeling (Alteryx/SQL), and Business Intelligence/Data Warehousing experience 
Advanced Tableau experience in Dashboard Development, including Tableau server management, level of detail calculations, built custom charts
Experience with basic automation using Microsoft Excel and VBA or any other programming language, with a working knowledge of handling complex data structures
Experience of leading large-scale projects from a technical aspect
Experience with HR data analysis and HR domain knowledge is preferred, however not mandatory
Deep interest and aptitude in data, metrics, and analysis




YOU'LL WORK WITH




As part of the People analytics team, you will modernize HR platforms, capabilities & engagement, automate/digitize core HR processes and operations and enable greater efficiency. You will collaborate with the global people teams and colleagues across BCG to manage the life cycle of all BCG employees.




The People Management Team (PMT) is comprised of several centers of expertise including HR Operations, People Analytics, Career Development, Learning & Development, Talent Acquisition & Branding, Compensation, and Mobility. Our centers of expertise work together to build out new teams and capabilities by sourcing, acquiring and retaining the best, diverse talent for BCG’s Global Specialty Businesses.




We develop talent and capabilities, while enhancing managers’ effectiveness, and building affiliation and engagement in our global offices. The PMT also harmonizes process efficiencies, automation, and global standardization. Through analytics and digitalization, we are always looking to expand our PMT capabilities and coverage.
